ygData.subject: neglecting our families?
ygData.msgSnippet:
There are several lists on Yahoo for family members who feel that
their loved one has an internet addiction.  Apparently, she felt
that she was needed more
ygData.messageBody:
There are several lists on Yahoo for family members who feel that
their loved one has an internet addiction. Apparently, she felt
that she was needed more online than off. You probably made her
feel as if you didn't care about her anymore. Her guildies did.

Frankly, at 47 yrs old, I have seen enough fireworks (twice a year
off my back deck.) I have no other family alive except the hubby
and the kids. (And his family is in California. I don't go along
because 5 hour plane rides are bad for my health.) And parades are
just flat-out boring. I DO have hot, fresh food every night for
the boys. I am a substitute teacher, part-time grad. student,
computer repair technician, run 17 yahoo groups and do nutritional
consulting. I got into EQ so I would have something to talk about
with my boys who are also bored by parades. Maybe the real world
just isn't as challenging as learning to "swim" underwater in a 3-D
castle.

Having them at their father's, on the weekends, really helps my
relationship with my husband and allows me to have a really clean
house for two days a week. He just lets them sit around and watch
tv all the time. At least when they are playing EQ, they are
thinking.

Your reminder is well-taken though as my hubby does sometimes feel
neglected because I am not ready when he is.


*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 7/6/03 at Dave wrote:

____Oh, thank goodness your holiday won't be ruined by the presence
of
____your family. God forbid you'd have to be sucked away from
Evercrack
____to attend a parade, cookout, or firework display.



----------------------------
Dr. Mom, mother of the Alphabet soup boys:

Bryn Bailey October 17, 1984-ADHD, gifted, OCD, LD and allergic

Aubrey Bailey April 12, 1986 -ADD, gifted, LD, and allergic
Devin Bailey April 10, 1988 -ADD, talented, LD and allergic
Curran Bailey January 30, 1990-ADD, brain damaged, OCD, seizures
Erin Bailey May 6, 1993 -ADHD, OCD, gifted, and allergic
